body.prompt:
Generate a fake conversation between a customer and an agent.
The agent should introduce themselves, their company and give the customer
their name. The agent should ask for the customer's name.
As part of the conversation, have the agent ask for two pieces of
personal information.  Spell out numbers. For example, 1000 should be
said as one zero zero zero, not one thousand. The conversation should be
at least 10 lines long and be complete. At the end
of the conversation, the agent should thank the customer for their time
and end the conversation. Return the conversation formatted 
like the following example:

{'conversation': 
    [
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': 'xxxxx'}, 
    {'speaker': 'Customer', 'message': "xxxxx."}, 
    {'speaker': 'Agent', 'message': "xxxxxx"}
    ] 
}


In this conversation, the agent's name is Steven Powell and the customer's name is Marilyn Taylor.  The conversation is about Old Stone Stocks (a Brokerage Company ) and is a conversation about privacy.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Hello! My name is Sarah, and I am with Bright Solutions. How may I assist you today?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: Hi, Sarah. I'm looking for some information on your services.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Great! I would be happy to help you with that. May I have your name, please?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, John. Can I also get your email address so I can send you the details?

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Thank you, John. Lastly, could you please provide me with your phone number?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: My phone number is two zero two, five five five, one two three four.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Got it! Thank you for providing that information, John. Is there anything specific about our services that you would like to know?

body.speaker: Customer
body.message: I would like to know about your pricing options.

body.speaker: Agent
body.message: Absolutely! I will include the pricing details in the email I send you. Thank you for your time, John, and have a great day!
